author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body: Pretty weird name, have you seen https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/v1/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1 ? Maybe the name makes sense, what does the package do? Would be nice to add some information in your readme.
Apologies, I didn't realize a human would be looking at this.  I've added a bit more detail.  The package name is definitely appropriate, at lease within the (niche) stellar spectrum community.

Great! Can you also add some compatibility constraints to your Project file? At least e..g
```toml
[compat]
julia = "1"
```
see https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/v1/compatibility/.

Consider enabling TagBot to make sure the release is persistent in your repo, see https://discourse.julialang.org/t/ann-tagbot-creates-tags-and-releases-for-your-julia-packages-when-theyre-registered/23084
